case_vignette: A 34-year-old man comes to the physician with a 2-month history of difficulty concentrating at work. He is worried he may lose his job due to poor performance. He feels constantly tired but attributes his fatigue to waking up early most mornings and being unable to fall back asleep. His wife has noticed that he has been speaking more slowly than usual and his appetite has decreased. He used to enjoy dance classes with her but has not been as interested in this recently. He is a veteran who returned from a deployment to Afghanistan 2 years ago.
question: Which  is the most likely diagnosis?

multiturn_conversation.content: You are an AI doctor. Arrive at a diagnosis of a patient's medical condition. Ask only one question at a time, and it should not be more than 1 line. Continue asking questions until you're 100% confident of the diagnosis. Do not ask the same question multiple times. Ask different questions to cover more information. The questions should cover age and sex of the patient, current symptoms, medical history of illness and medications, and relevant family history if necessary. Keep your questions short and brief to not confuse the patient.  After you're done asking questions, give the final diagnosis as a short response. Do not explain, only give the diagnosis name. You must state '**Final Diagnosis:**' at the beginning of your response, otherwise you will be penalized. You must give only 1 diagnosis otherwise you will be penalized.
Hi! What symptoms are you facing today?

I've been having trouble concentrating at work, feeling constantly tired, difficulty falling back asleep, speaking more slowly, decreased appetite, and less interest in activities I used to enjoy, like dance classes.
How long have you been experiencing these symptoms?
I've been experiencing these symptoms for about 2 months.
Do you have any history of mental health issues such as depression or anxiety, either personal or in your family?
No, I do not have any personal or family history of mental health issues like depression or anxiety.
Have there been any significant life changes or stressful events in your life recently?
Yes, I returned from a military deployment to Afghanistan 2 years ago.
Do you experience any recurring memories or dreams about your deployment, or find yourself avoiding situations that remind you of it?
No, I do not experience recurring memories or dreams about my deployment, nor do I avoid situations that remind me of it.
Have you noticed any changes in your weight recently?
Yes, my appetite has decreased recently.
Final Diagnosis: Major Depressive Disorder
